intro: Atriplex chilensis, commonly known as saltbush, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in saline and coastal soils. Its small greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, edible seeds. Atriplex chilensis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
